comment: Small (app size) and functional.

title: Does what it says on the tin.
comment: Simply does what it says. I use it successfully over both local home network and remotely over the internet.  It uses a small footprint.   NB A lot of these apps take criticism unfairly getting a wake up on Lan packet configuration on a PC involves a number of hoops and "a one size fits all solution" really cant be given needing a bit of experimentation on your own set up. You normally need to alter you home network router settings, then bios setting/s of the computer/s you wish to wake up, then the hardware power management of the computers network card from the operating system (you need a hard wired connection to your router WIFI connections don't work with wake up on lan packets) and then you need to play about with 3rd party dynamic dns services and software to cope with your ISP's TCP/IP address lease to your PC changing over time. Get any of these steps and neither this or any other similar app is going to behave as you expect.  Persevere and you end up with a really handy ability that can be used with other software such as airstream to access your PC anywhere and power it up and shut it down remotely.

title: Only works sometimes
comment: I used to use the app all the time but now it rarely works connected to my home network, however it always works if doing a wol to the same pc from outside the network firewall which is the opposite of what you'd think since ports have to be forwarded in order for that way to work. Not sure why it isn't working in the firewall...other wol apps I've tried work fine but this one is my preferred app but it's not working right anymore unfortunately. Using fusion wol now since it always works and resolves hosts.

comment: Works but I have a couple of suggestions. First the default broadcast address should be automatically detected from the currently connected wifi if one is connected. This makes it more convenient when you are just coming home from work but you may also want to schedule this not to run prior to the time you leave so some scheduling options are needed. Lastly is there a signal to send a machine back to hybernation?

title: Works on lan and over internet
comment: Works correctly on LAN and over internet. You might have problems over internet to wake the PC, but that's not the app fault (read how internet works :) ).  Works 100% if you have a router: just configure it to forward the port used in the app (port 9 to the PC IP). For the best results ensure that the router has DHCP lease set to forever and if it has ARP binding - bind the IP to the network MAC.  The 6th star is for not asking useless permissions :)

title: Just Plain Nice Util! :)
comment: This cool little app does exactly what it says and 5 Stars to the developer as well!  Cool guy, who responds and is quite helpful and patient with those who are not too familiar with this stuff!  And his (this) app auto-remembers, so you don't even have to set it up, nor do any typing the next time you wish to wake up the same device again!  I really love it!  It's great!  The developer is great!  Get it and support it!  One little tap and your PC/Laptop, etc is awake!  For those new to this, remember, leave the last digit in the IP at what it is, since it's the MAC Address of the device that responds to the wake up call, not the IP Address!  You need the MAC Address!  In Windows, run "CMD" and then I believe it's "IPConfig /All" to get it.  Double check me on that though. :)
